start.text:
Incoming mail:

Sender: support@universal-parts.univ
Subject: IMPORTANT! PRODUCT RECALL

Dear customer, all products of the collection 'LIGHTSENSORS' are being recalled for false-triggering issues.

Please send them back as soon as possible, information is provided in attached document.

choices.text: “Do I even have any in my station?“
“I don't have time for this“ [ignore it]

sensors-listing-aude.text: Aude: “There are 23 of these sensors installed in a particular hallway, they are used to turn lights on when movement is detected.“

choices.text: “These lights could be turned on everyday, they would not even consume a fraction of the required resources to send this mail across the entire galaxy“ [ignore it]
“I WILL NOT ALLOW FAULTY GEAR IN MY STATION“
“Only 23 eh? It would only take a couple of hours to dismount them“

price-estimation.text: You start packing up the sensors for shipping. And then think back about an add you saw recently: premium light sensors on sales from KEEPTHELIGHTSON company, it would cost you [10 €€€] shipping included.

choices.text: ”Why spend my hardly earned money for something that futile?” [wait for UNIVERSAL-PARTS replacement sensors]
”I'm not trusting UNIVERSAL-PARTS again on this, better play it safe” [order KEEPTHELIGHTSON sensors for 10 €€€]

KEEPTHELIGHTSON_sensors_received.text: You received KEEPTHELIGHTSON light sensors, they work as expected, fine.

choices.text: ”Delightful, another source of problems out of my mind”

UNIVERSAL_PARTS_sensors_received.text: You received UNIVERSAL-PARTS light sensors, they work as expected.

minor_malfunction.text: Sometimes, some lights are already on when you go through a particular hallway, it's not a big deal.

major_malfunction.text: A few days after not changing your light sensors, a fire happens in that particular hallway. The area put itself in quarantine when the fire was getting to big. With no oxygen left it died rapidly.

fire_reason.text:
You learn by checking the logs that one light sensor suddenly did start false-triggering.. 1000 times per second! This caused the light to malfunction and ignite itself.
The fire damaged nearby cables inside the wall, unless you repair them, this station area is unusable.

choices.text: “This station has other working areas like this, I'll be fine“ [do nothing]
“All of this for some gadget light sensors!!“ [repair the wall cables for 100 €€€]

station_lost_one_area.text: Your station is now missing one area

wall_repaired.text: Wall is repaired, you now resort replacing the sensors
